paragraphs.content: A while loop is used to repeateadly execute a block of code (loop through) while a specific condition is met. It is similiar to a for loop but a for loop is used when the programmer knows exactly when to end the loop.

paragraphs.subheading: How to create a while loop
paragraphs.content: Look at the example below. Within the brackets after 'while', there is a single statement which defines the condition which must be met in order for the loop to execute the block of code in the while loop.

trueFalseQuiz.question: True or false: While loops are less efficient than for loops.
trueFalseQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct! While loops and for loops both have different use cases and efficiencies based on the parameters and length of options.
trueFalseQuiz.feedbackWrong: Wrong! While loops and for loops both have different use cases and efficiencies based on the parameters and length of options.

paragraphs.content: Within while loops, you must change the value which is involved in the condition so that the loop actually ends; otherwise the loop will be infinite.
